title: The ocean absorbed a stunning amount of heat in 2025
description: Earth’s oceans reached their highest heat levels on record in 2025, absorbing vast amounts of excess energy from the atmosphere. This steady buildup has accelerated since the 1990s and is now driving stronger storms, heavier rainfall, and rising sea levels. While surface temperatures fluctuate year to year, the ocean’s long-term warming trend shows no sign of slowing.

While surface temperatures fluctuate year to year, the ocean’s long-term warming trend shows no sign of slowing.
